adr_address: 38 Rue Sainte-Croix de la Bretonnerie, 75004 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Stylish rooms mixing 1950s vintage furnishings & contemporary decor, plus free Wi-Fi & breakfast.

formatted_address: 38 Rue Sainte-Croix de la Bretonnerie, 75004 Paris, France
name: Le 1er Etage Marais

reviews.text:
We were there for 2 nights and this was the perfect place to stay! easy to get around via metro or walking, very close to Notre Dame, and a ton of great places to eat and drink.
**Keep in mind that this is a huge city and area with a lot of nightlife, so you will hear some street sounds even with the windows closed. Also, there was a slight smell from time to time coming from the shower drain, but you can close off the shower Door. Nither of these things impacted our stay though.

More importantly the Hosts were great! So helpful and responsive. They stock the shared kitchen with coffees and have a few tables where you can have a small sit down breakfast (with table service I think?)

Great time! We will be back!

Had much better memories from the first time we stayed, in 2022.
The hotel is recommendable because of the fabulous location.  However maintenance is not high on the hotel’s priority list as the premises are worn out.  Broken curtain, broken window handle, dirty under the sink, dirty around the toilet, dirty toilet brush, broken hook in bathroom, broken soap holder in the shower.   Awkward silence in the breakfast room could be broken with some soft. background music, and not sitting 20 cm from the receptionist.  Bread was not fresh.
So great location,  it else bwah

We were here for a full week & we were so lucky to have found this quiet little gem in Le Marais. The location could not have been more perfect for our first time visiting Paris. Moving around in and out of the city was a breeze & we loved the variety of food & shopping literally within a couple minutes walking distance from our accommodation. We appreciate the cold filtered tap water & selection of nespresso/tea available for us on our early mornings & late nights. Also, our bed being made & the fresh big towels were a daily comfort we became accustomed to. Thank you all so much for providing a comfortable place for our first visit to Paris ✨ 💙🇫🇷 to many more!

Great experience at 1er Etage Marais.  Lovely room with a simple breakfast and coffee set-up available each morning.  Communication with management was excellent, everyone on-sight was friendly and helpful.  Location is very close to Pompidou, and in a part of Marais with plenty of walkable options for shopping, food, nightclubs, or anything else.  A/C worked well.  Our room faced the street, but noise was not an issue for us - it quieted down by 10-11pm.

This hotel has an indiscreet door on a side street (there is no name or sign for this hotel on the street). You will put in a code, and walk in. You will face a dark, spooky corridor. Walk a little bit and there’s another door to put in the code. Go thru and you will see a narrow, winding, carpeted, mildewy looking staircase. Then you will see another door and you put in a code to get in the actual hotel. There are some positives: The staff were nice and helpful. The inside of the hotel was very clean. Breakfast was good.
Negatives:
There is a gay club (or bar) with loud music across the street from this hotel. The club is open from 7:00 pm to 3:00 or 4:00 am. Our room (#4) was right where we could see this club with its flashing pink/purple lights from our window. Our room smelled like a very strong cleaning agent. The smell gave us a headache, but because of the club’s loud music we couldn’t open the window to let some fresh air in. When the club finally closed, it was time for the very noisy garbage trucks to show up to pick up the garbage from all the businesses in the street. So we still couldn’t open the window.
I am sorry to say that, for us, all the positives that I noted above do not offset the negative points. Thinking back, we could have complained about the strong smell, noisy bar and garbage trucks, but we didn’t. We stayed at this hotel for two nights and paid a total of 500 euros. For this much money we expected better.

vicinity: 38 Rue Sainte-Croix de la Bretonnerie, Paris
